thread.title: REVEALED: Queen could be RULER of US in shock new plans
thread.title_full: REVEALED: Queen could be RULER of US in shock new plans

title: REVEALED: Queen could be RULER of US in shock new plans
text:
“The UK rather left this treasure in the attic, and forgot about it because people were so glued to Brussels.” Michael Lake, the director of the Royal Commonwealth Society 
As the Head of the Commonwealth, some members share the Queen as Head of State. 
These 16 states are known as the Commonwealth Realms and include Australia, New Zealand, Canada and Jamaica among others. 
In theory, the US could chose to appoint the Queen as Head of State if it were to join the Commonwealth Realm. 
But this is highly unlikely as the mooted plan is about joining the Commonwealth as an “associate” member for trade purposes. 
GETTY FAN: Donald Trump told Theresa May his mother was a fan of the Queen Right Royal larf! Queen's funniest pictures Thursday, 13th October 2016 To help celebrate Queen Elizabeth II's 90th birthday we have collated someof her most candid pictures. 1 / 14 HM Queen Elizabeth II watching Queens Cup Polo, 2010 
Mr Lake claims former UKIP leader Nigel Farage and Trump tabled the move. 
He sent a letter to Trump mapping out “imaginative way” in which the two nations could work together. 
The response was said to be “very positive” in Washington, Andy Whigmore, a close aide to Farage, told the Telegraph. 
Mr Lark said: "It has been very introspective, it needs to [be] more extrovert. 
“In that sense we have adopted a policy of getting branches of the Commonwealth in non-commonwealth countries.” 
Trump, whose mother is Scottish, has invited the Queen to a game of golf during his first UK state visit. 
A Downing Street insider told the Express he wants to go “one better” than Obama and do “the full Monty” with the Queen. Related articles
